definition.text: The Github Storage node contains definitions of all public github repositories set up as Open Storage locations on the Superalgos Peer to Peer network for the current User Profile.

paragraphs.text: Each child Github Storage Container node identifies a particular public github repository as an Open Storage location.

In order to be able to upload data to a Github repository, your bots need access to the api token for each repository being used as open storage. These api tokens are stored in a special file call ApiSecrets.json
This file is stored under the My-Secrets directory and needs to have the following structure:

You need to have an object declaring the api token for each open storage repository you define and plan to use on the peer to peer network. Any repositories that do not have an api token saved will not be accessible for your bots to upload data.
